meanings.definition: Capable of being regained or retrieved.
meanings.sent1: The lost toy was recoverable from under the bed.
meanings.sent2: The deleted file on the computer was recoverable with the right software.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the laser pointer was recoverable after it disappeared behind the couch.
meanings.sent4: Her trust in him was like a recoverable treasure buried deep in the sand.
meanings.sent5: The key to success is to see every setback as a recoverable opportunity.

meanings.definition: Able to be recovered or restored.
meanings.sent1: The old painting was recoverable with some careful restoration work.
meanings.sent2: The data on the damaged hard drive was recoverable by the IT specialist.
meanings.sent3: The chef believed the burnt dish was recoverable with a sprinkle of fresh herbs.
meanings.sent4: His hope for a better future was like a recoverable flame flickering in the darkness.
meanings.sent5: The friendship was strained but still recoverable with honest communication.
